hanzi-su-wiki:
結

Значения

Связывать, соединять, заключать; причесывать, навязывать; связывать, привязывать, перевязывать

Мнемоника

  • Считалось, что в дописьменный период существовало узелковое письмо. Верёвочные 糸 узелки древности, в век мудрости и счастья 吉.

  • "Я связал из нити 糸 амулет на удачу 吉."

Варианты

结

(Simplified: 结)

heisig_chinese_memo: You're lucky if Spidey ties you up with his web and you get out of it. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: tie, thread, spiderman, aerosol, samurai, mouth
Keyword_KANJIDIC: tie, bind, contract, join, organize, do up hair, fasten
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: связать, связывать, контракт, Join, организовывать, застегивать волосы, застегните
koohiiStory1: Ok, here, you have to think of the phrase "TIE the knot" , which means a wedding (this kanji is used in the marriage compound 結婚 けっこん ). Now, at US weddings, it ends with the couple driving away with cans being dragged behind the car. So here, think of SPIDERMAN, who will TIE the knot with Mary Jane. At his wedding, Spider THREAD attached (or TIED) to SPRAYCANS are being drug behind the limo as they drive off.
koohiiStory2: Spiderman and a fan have a competition to see who can tie up the most enemies fastest. Spidey´s using his webs and the fan is using an aerosol can of silly string. So far they are tied.
jp_example_words:
結核(けっかく): tuberculosis, tubercule
結合(けつごう): combination, union
結晶(けっしょう): crystal, crystallization
結成(けっせい): formation
結束(けっそく): union, unity
妥結(だけつ): agreement
団結(だんけつ): unity, union, combination
結び(むすび): ending, conclusion, union
結び付き(むすびつき): connection, relation
結び付く(むすびつく): to be connected or related, to join together
結び付ける(むすびつける): to combine, to join, to tie on, to attach with a knot
結果(けっか): result, consequence
結局(けっきょく): after all, eventually
結論(けつろん): reason, sum up, conclude
結ぶ(むすぶ): tie, bind, link
結構(けっこう): splendid, nice, wonderful, delicious, sweet, construction, architecture, well enough, tolerably
結婚(けっこん): marriage
jp_readingExamples: 結ぶ (むす.ぶ), 結う (ゆ.う), 結わえる (ゆ.わえる)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You use a thread for good luck by binding two fingers together. You tie them nice and tight.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Tying two fingers together with a good luck thread is very common where you're from.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: After you bind your fingers, the good luck starts pouring in. Literally. Suddenly ketsup (けつ) starts pouring down from the heavens.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: This ketsup is exactly what you were looking for, but now it won't stop. You need to get out of this bind by untying the thread on your finger. But it won't budge. It's covered in ketsup. Help! You're going to drown!
Ru_Meaning: tie, bind, contract, join, organize, do up hair, fasten
Ru_Radicals: 口 (рот), 士 (воин), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 糸 (нить)
Ru_trainchinese:

jiē: (графема) твердый, прочный, крепкий (никогда не используется отдельно)
jiē: (глаг) давать, приносить (плоды); заикаться, запинаться
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the good luck (吉) thread (糸) binds
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Spiderman is too lazy to put effort into cleaning his ties so he just sprays them with an aerosol can.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "糸", " ji " sound, the original meaning is knotting. " Knot " is not found in the Jia Jin inscriptions, "Shuo Wen": "Di Ye. From Shito, Ji Sheng." Ancient classics use its original meaning, such as "Easy • Xi Ci Xia": "The ancient times ruled by knotting the rope, the later saints Yi It is a book contract." Another example is "Han Shu • Dong Zhongshu Biography": "Lin Yuan envy fish, it is better to retreat and build a net." The scripts on silk and bamboo also use their original meaning, such as "Mawangdui. "Lao Zi Yi Ben" 205: "Use it for the people to tie the rope."

" Knot " can be used as a knot or a block-like protrusion like a knot, such as in the classic "Zuo Zhuan • Zhaogong Eleventh Year": "Clothes have pleats and knots." Du's note: "Knots, tie knots." Another example is Liu Xin's "Seven Lue" in the Han Dynasty: "There are many complicated explanations, and the opposite is in Ping An." This meaning is also seen in the texts on bamboo and silk, such as "Sleeping Tiger Di Qin Bamboo Slips. Legal Questions and Answers" 84: "Is it possible to (what)?"

" Knot " can also be used as a restraint and restraint, as in "The Biography of the Century • Bian Que Cang": "Cut the skin and relax the muscles, and break the veins and tendons."

" Knot " also has the meaning of condensing, concluding, and forming. The meaning of "condensation" is like "Luoyang Jialan Jibhe Country": "There is a big snow mountain, the morning and evening knots, looking like a jade peak." The meaning of "condense" is like the Tao Qian of the Jin Dynasty. Make an oath, and be afraid of imposing gifts." The meaning of "formation" is like "Hanshu·Liyuezhi": "Deng Penglai, knot Wuji." Yan Shigu's commentary: "Knot, Cheng Ye."

" Knot " can also be interpreted as end and end. For example, "Selected Works • Zhang Heng's "Tokyo Fu"": "Zhang Lin, you will make a student camp." Li Shan's commentary quoted Xue Zong as saying: "Jie, stop." It's the end of it." Gao Luu noted: "The end is the end."
humanum_short_description_en: From "糸", " ji " sound, the original meaning is knotting.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「吉」聲，本義為打結。「結」不見於甲金文，《說文》：「締也。从糸，吉聲。」古代典籍用其本義，如《易•繫辭下》：「上古結繩而治，後世聖人易之以書契。」又如《漢書•董仲舒傳》：「臨淵羨魚，不如退而結網」。簡帛文字也用其本義，如《馬王堆．老子乙本》205：「使民復結繩而用之。」

　　「結」可用作結子或如結子的塊狀凸起物，如典籍《左傳•昭公十一年》：「衣有襘，帶有結。」杜預注：「結，帶結也。」又如漢代劉歆《七略》：「紛繁釋結，反之於平安。」簡帛文字亦見此義，如《睡虎地秦簡．法律答問》84：「拔劍伐，斬人髮結，可（何）論？」

　　「結」還可用作束縛、箝制，如《世紀•扁鵲倉公列傳》：「割皮解肌，決脈結筋」。

　　「結」也有凝結、締結、形成之義。「凝結」義有如《洛陽伽藍記鉢和國》：「有大雪山，朝融夕結，望若玉峰。」「締結」義有如晉代陶潛〈閒情賦〉：「欲自往以結誓，懼冒禮之爲諐」。「形成」義有如《漢書•禮樂志》：「登蓬萊，結無極。」顏師古注：「結，成也。」

　　「結」亦可釋作結束、結尾。如《文選•張衡〈東京賦〉》：「迄上林，結徒營。」李善注引薛綜曰：「結，止也。」《淮南子•繆稱》：「故君子行，思乎其所結。」高誘注：「結，要終也。」

④收束，完了(liǎo)：結賬。結局。結案。結果。結論。歸根結底。

從「 糸 」，「 吉 」聲，本義為打結。「 結 」不見於甲金文，《說文》：「締也。从糸，吉聲。」古代典籍用其本義，如《易•繫辭下》：「上古結繩而治，後世聖人易之以書契。」又如《漢書•董仲舒傳》：「臨淵羨魚，不如退而結網」。簡帛文字也用其本義，如《馬王堆．老子乙本》205：「使民復結繩而用之。」 「 結 」可用作結子或如結子的塊狀凸起物，如典籍《左傳•昭公十一年》：「衣有襘，帶有結。」杜預注：「結，帶結也。」又如漢代劉歆《七略》：「紛繁釋結，反之於平安。」簡帛文字亦見此義，如《睡虎地秦簡．法律答問》84：「拔劍伐，斬人髮結，可（何）論？」 「 結 」還可用作束縛、箝制，如《世紀•扁鵲倉公列傳》：「割皮解肌，決脈結筋」。 「 結 」也有凝結、締結、形成之義。「凝結」義有如《洛陽伽藍記鉢和國》：「有大雪山，朝融夕結，望若玉峰。」「締結」義有如晉代陶潛〈閒情賦〉：「欲自往以結誓，懼冒禮之爲諐」。「形成」義有如《漢書•禮樂志》：「登蓬萊，結無極。」顏師古注：「結，成也。」 「 結 」亦可釋作結束、結尾。如《文選•張衡〈東京賦〉》：「迄上林，結徒營。」李善注引薛綜曰：「結，止也。」《淮南子•繆稱》：「故君子行，思乎其所結。」高誘注：「結，要終也。」
From " 糸", " ji" sound, the original meaning is knotting. " Knot" is not found in the Jia Jin inscriptions, "Shuo Wen": "Di Ye. From Shito, Ji Sheng." Ancient classics use its original meaning, such as "Easy • Xi Ci Xia": "The ancient times ruled by knotting the rope, the later saints Yi It is a book contract." Another example is "Han Shu • Dong Zhongshu Biography": "Lin Yuan envy fish, it is better to retreat and build a net." The scripts on silk and bamboo also use their original meaning, such as "Mawangdui. "Lao Zi Yi Ben" 205: "Use it for the people to tie the rope." " Knot" can be used as a knot or a block-like protrusion like a knot, such as in the classic "Zuo Zhuan • Zhaogong Eleventh Year": "Clothes have pleats and knots." Du's note: "Knots, tie knots." Another example is Liu Xin's "Seven Lue" in the Han Dynasty: "There are many complicated explanations, and the opposite is in Ping An." This meaning is also seen in the texts on bamboo and silk, such as "Sleeping Tiger Di Qin Bamboo Slips. Legal Questions and Answers" 84: "Is it possible to (what)?" " Knot" can also be used as a restraint and restraint, as in "The Biography of the Century • Bian Que Cang": "Cut the skin and relax the muscles, and break the veins and tendons." " Knot" also has the meaning of condensing, concluding, and forming. The meaning of "condensation" is like "Luoyang Jialan Jibhe Country": "There is a big snow mountain, the morning and evening knots, looking like a jade peak." The meaning of "condense" is like the Tao Qian of the Jin Dynasty. Make an oath, and be afraid of imposing gifts." The meaning of "formation" is like "Hanshu·Liyuezhi": "Deng Penglai, knot Wuji." Yan Shigu's commentary: "Knot, Cheng Ye." " Knot" can also be interpreted as end and end. For example, "Selected Works • Zhang Heng's "Tokyo Fu"": "Zhang Lin, you will make a student camp." Li Shan's commentary quoted Xue Zong as saying: "Jie, stop." It's the end of it." Gao Luu noted: "The end is the end."

結字的基本解释

結
jié

結
jiē
均见“结”。

結字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jié］
［《廣韻》古屑切，入屑，見。］
“结1”的繁体字。
(1)用线、绳、草等条状物打结或编织。
(2)指结成之物。
(3)比喻疑难困惑的关键。
(4)系；扎缚。
(5)连接。
(6)联结；结合。
(7)聚合；凝聚。
(8)形容忧愁、气愤积聚不得发泄。
(9)建造；构筑。
(10)植物长出（果实或种子）。
(11)屈曲；盘旋。
(12)结束；终了。
(13)判决；治罪。
(14)旧时表明保证负责或承认了结的文书。
(15)揪住，扭住。
(16)姓。金有结什角。见《金史》本传。
[②]［jiē］
“结2”的繁体字。
见“結2巴”、“結2實”。
[③]［jì］
［《集韻》吉詣切，去霽，見。］
“结3”的繁体字。通“髻1”。
发髻。

結字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　結； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页921第34
【廣韻】【正韻】古屑切【集韻】【韻會】吉屑切，?音拮。【說文】締也。【易·繫辭】上古結繩而治。【詩·檜風】我心蘊結兮。又【曹風】心如結兮。【疏】如物之裹結。【禮·曲禮】德車結旌。【註】結，謂收斂之也。【疏】結，纏其旒著於竿也。【前漢·五行志】衣有襘，帶有結。【註】結，締結之結也。　又【博雅】曲也。　又【玉篇】要也。　又【集韻】胡計切，音系。【前漢·張釋之傳】跪而結之。【註】師古曰：結，讀曰係。　又【集韻】激質切，音吉。義同。　又【集韻】吉詣切，音計。【前漢·陸賈傳】尉佗魁結箕踞。【註】師古曰：結，讀曰髻。

結字的源字形

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
結字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jié］
["Guangyun" ancient chip cutting, into the chip, see. ]
Traditional characters for "结1".
(1) Knotting or knitting with threads, ropes, grass and other strips.
(2) Refers to what is formed.
(3) Metaphor is the key to difficulty and confusion.
(4) Department; tie up.
(5) Connection.
(6) Connection; combination.
(7) Polymerization; Coagulation.
(8) Describe the accumulation of sorrow and anger.
(9) Construction; construction.
(10) Plants grow (fruits or seeds).
(11) Buckling; circling.
(12) End; end.
(13) Judgment; conviction.
(14) In the past, it was an instrument that indicated that it was responsible for guaranteeing or acknowledging the conclusion.
(15) Grab, twist.
(16) Last name. The gold has knots. See the biography of "Golden History".
[②]［jiē］

[③]［jì］

jié, jì, jiē
вм. 结

結

Значения

Связывать, соединять, заключать; причесывать, навязывать; связывать, привязывать, перевязывать

Мнемоника

  • Считалось, что в дописьменный период существовало узелковое письмо. Верёвочные 糸 узелки древности, в век мудрости и счастья 吉.

  • "Я связал из нити 糸 амулет на удачу 吉."

Варианты

结

Radicals: 糸, 吉  (thread, good-luck)
Meaning Mnemonic
You use a thread for good luck by binding two fingers together. You tie them nice and tight.
Tying two fingers together with a good luck thread is very common where you're from.
Reading Mnemonic
After you bind your fingers, the good luck starts pouring in. Literally. Suddenly ketsup (けつ) starts pouring down from the heavens.
This ketsup is exactly what you were looking for, but now it won't stop. You need to get out of this bind by untying the thread on your finger. But it won't budge. It's covered in ketsup. Help! You're going to drown!

Examples: 結ぶ (むす.ぶ), 結う (ゆ.う), 結わえる (ゆ.わえる)
口 (рот), 士 (воин), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 糸 (нить)
